uk.ac.macaulay.util
Class GISKeyedRaster<T>

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.macaulay.util.Table<T>
      uk.ac.macaulay.util.GISRaster<T>
          uk.ac.macaulay.util.GISKeyedRaster<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>
public class GISKeyedRaster<T>
extends GISRaster<T>

A GISRaster with a converter that maps entries in the table to colours.

Author:
Gary Polhill

Field Summary
private  GISRasterImageConverter<T> converter
          The converter providing a one-to-one mapping from entries to colours.

converter

private GISRasterImageConverter<T> converter
The converter providing a one-to-one mapping from entries to colours.

Constructor Detail

GISKeyedRaster

public GISKeyedRaster(Table<T> table,
                      double originX,
                      double originY,
                      double cellSize,
                      T nodata_value,
                      GISRasterImageConverter<T> converter)
Constructor converting a table to a GISKeyedRaster with a specified 'no data' value.

Parameters:
table - A table containing data
originX - The georeference for the left edge of the table
originY - The georeference for the bottom edge of the table
cellSize - The size of the (square) cells
nodata_value - Value indicating no data
converter - The converter to use to supply colours for each cell

GISKeyedRaster

public GISKeyedRaster(Table<T> table,
                      double originX,
                      double originY,
                      double cellSize,
                      GISRasterImageConverter<T> converter)
Constructor converting a table with no 'no data' value

Parameters:
table - The table to convert
originX - Georeference for left edge of the table
originY - Georeference for bottom edge of the table
cellSize - The size of one edge of the (square) cells
converter - Converter to supply colours for each cell

GISKeyedRaster

public GISKeyedRaster(int nrows,
                      int ncols,
                      double originX,
                      double originY,
                      double cellSize,
                      T nodata_value,
                      GISRasterImageConverter<T> converter)
Constructor for an empty GISKeyedRaster with a specified 'no data' value

Parameters:
nrows - Number of rows in the raster
ncols - Number of columns in the raster
originX - Georeference for left edge of left column
originY - Georeference for bottom edge of bottom row
cellSize - The size of one edge of the (square) cells
nodata_value - Value to use to indicate 'no data'
converter - Converter to supply colours for each cell

converter - Converter to supply colours for each cell

GISKeyedRaster

public GISKeyedRaster(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                      java.util.Map<T,java.awt.Color> key,
                      double originX,
                      double originY,
                      double cellSize)
Constructor using a buffered image and a key to build a GISKeyedRaster

Parameters:
image - The image from which to get colours
key - The key mapping data to colours
originX - Georeference for left edge of the image
originY - Georeference for bottom edge of the image
cellSize - Length of one side of a pixel (assumed square)

GISKeyedRaster

                      GISRasterImageConverter<T> converter,
                      double originX,
                      double originY,
                      double cellSize)
Constructor using a buffered image and a converter to build a GISKeyedRaster

Parameters:
image - The image from which to get colours
converter - Converter mapping colours to data
originX - Georeference for the left edge of the image
originY - Georeference for the bottom edge of the image
cellSize - Length of one side of a pixel (assumed square)

getImage

public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()

fillImage

public void fillImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
Fill the image (assumed to be of the correct size) with the raster data, using the default zoom factor (1)

Parameters:
image - The image to fill

fillImage

public void fillImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                      int zoomFactor)
Fill the supplied image with colours corresponding to the raster data, using the zoom factor. The image is assumed to be of the correct size. If it is too big, then the extra pixels will not be set. If too small, then the data in those cells will not be written.

Parameters:
image - Image to fill
zoomFactor - Zoom factor (number of pixels per cell in the data)
